author: Special Correspondent
text:
A large number of conservancy workers attached to various departments, hospital staff, office staff and nurses were screened at an eye screening camp held as part of the eye protection awareness week at the Government Headquarters Hospital in the town which concluded on Saturday.

The event was brought up by the Ophthalmology Wing of the Government Headquarters Hospital and the District Blindness Control Society.

A team of ophthalmologists of the GH screened the conservancy workers and other staff throughout the week for various eye disorders such as glaucoma, colour blindness, double vision, farsightedness, astigmatism etc. People with defects were given treatment.

Speaking at the valediction, Dr. Kannappan, ophthalmologist, explained the causes, symptoms and the various eye disorders and also treatment and prevention methods. Underlining the importance of protecting the eyes, Dr. Kannappan said that the conservancy workers should use the protection glasses while using acid for cleaning purposes. This will help in protecting the eyes.

Dr. Ranganathan, Project Manager, District Blindness Control Society, said that the habit of self-medication for eye ailments will lead to serious consequences. Workers will even face the danger of losing total vision.

Whenever the workers face irritation in the eyes, they should immediately rush to ophthalmologists without applying drops on their own, Dr. Ranganathan said.
title: Eye screening camp conducted
